doc.title: Constant

value.content:
A constant is a value that the programmer cannot change, for example numbers (1, 2, 42). With variables, on the other hand, the programmer can assign a new value to a variable name already in use.

Like variables, some constants are bound to identifiers. For example, the identifier pi could be bound to the value 3.14… .

doc.summary: A constant is a value that the programmer cannot change, for example numbers (1, 2, 42). With variables, on the other hand, the programmer can assign a new value to a variable name already in use.
